website_summaries.verdict: A versatile cooler that stands out for its larger size.
pros: Comes with both an AC and 12-volt car adaptor
Pre-cools quickly, usually within a couple of hours
Door can be converted so it opens from left or right side
cons: A bit bulkier than some other options
Some reports of the fan or power cords dying within a few months

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I drive a semi so I've bought several of these over the years. Holds about a week's worth of stuff for me. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Parker

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these, two for gifts and one for me. Mine worked good for one road trip, then started blowing fuses. I couldn't keep enough fuses on hand to keep it running. The two gifts didn't last very long either until they started blowing fuses. On any of them, it didn't matter if they were plugged into 12v or 110v.
customer_reviews.author: BigOz

customer_reviews.title: Works like charm...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Keep that blower/vent clear. Hits 30° running the pre-chill in the house. Had to get a thermometer to keep constant track of the temperature. But now I totally trust it.
customer_reviews.author: This guy named Travis!

customer_reviews.title: It's Ok. Frosts up a lot. It has ...
customer_reviews.text: It's Ok. Frosts up a lot. It has a hard time keeping up when its warmer than 80 degrees. Amendment 60days and it has died. I will try to get a replacement from Coleman since it has a 1 year warranty
customer_reviews.author: Duwain Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for road trips but cable mod needed.
customer_reviews.text: After reading most of reviews and see that common problem is the blowing fuse and overheating connector I decided to go for it and see if I can find a solution since the overall product is perfect. To solve the overheating problem and fuse blowing I cut the cable from 8 feet to 4 feet which brought the connector temp down from 110 to 95 so I cut the cable again another 18 inches and as you can see on the pictures the temp is down to 85 degrees. The temp was check every 30 minutes after each modification was made.
customer_reviews.author: Julio C. Vega

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: We use this on our sailboat and have a single deep cycle battery with 2 - 150 watt solar panels to keep the cooler and cabin lights going. We have to unplug it when the sun goes down to have enough to run the cabin lights until the sun comes up. It draws a lot of power and collects a ton of condensation inside. Perhaps this is because our boat is in the Florida Keys. It doesn't get really cold, but the description let's you know that. Other than that it does a decent job.
customer_reviews.author: MissPhotog

customer_reviews.title: Fuse too small, otherwise great!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these for years as a line haul truck driver. They work great except for the factory installed fuse is only 7.5 amps. Those fuses blow quickly, so I replaced it with a 10 amp fuse with much better results. The cigarette lighter plug sometimes will wear out from excessive heat generated from the current draw. I am on my fourth cooler now. I typically retire them after a year or two of extremely heavy use. They are rugged, and tolerate a lot of bumps, scrapes, and drops. Additionally, I use an insulated bag inside the cooler in order to keep frozen items cold for much longer periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Died after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: We love these coolers - had one that worked for 13 years with lots of use. When it finally died, we ordered this replacement. It has quit working in 18 months, just suddenly stopped working one day when we were on a trip. No accidents occurred to it, just stopped working. Very disappointed since this is not a cheap cooler and our first one lasted so long!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: amw22

customer_reviews.title: not a refrigerator! heed their warning!
customer_reviews.text: We have an offgrid solar system so we wanted something to keep drinks cool that wouldn't use much energy and ran off 12V. This sucks, straight up. We also have spent 3x more money on the Chinese coolers that get to freezing temps (kalamera and cho). They are 10x better and more efficient than this (use less energy, protect your battery and get down to -4 degrees). This Coleman uses 5amp continuously and never turns off. In northern VT it averaged about 50 degrees. Drinks felt warm on not too hot days even. Returned. Wanted to warn others because the reviews fooled me. Spend more for something with a thermostat that works way better!
customer_reviews.author: MandM

customer_reviews.title: Draws too much power to use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my camper van so I didn't have to deal with ice. When it is plugged in to the house batteries (2 of them), it drains them in a day. It draws way too much power for what you get. Things stay cool, but not cold. I had milk go bad even though this was plugged in the entire time. I regret this purchase very much. I already have several standard coolers. Had I known I'd still be needing to get ice every day I'd have just used one of them. I do NOT recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: rollingblubber

customer_reviews.title: GREAT AT KEEPING THINGS COLD
customer_reviews.text: Skepticism might cause you to believe this would only be good for soft drinks but this bad mama jamma gets down to 38 degress in less than 30 minutes and stays there. Will run for hours (read 10-14) without any issues or excessive heat. Worth every penny. DO NOT let the price scare you. You'll get great value for your money. Consider the 110 volt adapter for use in your hotel or friends home. I used this for five weeks straight on the road and it NEVER failed or disappointed. Nothing spoiled.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this cooler in December to use on our travel trailer. We used it twice and now it has stopped working. Surprising because we are using another one just like it purchased 3 years ago with no problems. Guess they just don't make things like they use to anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia N. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Draws lots of power, 12 volt power connector fails
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine a couple of years, I have replaced the 12-volt connector 3 times. The spring pushing the fuse can't handle the current over a long time. I added an auto 12-volt connector to directly connect it to the 120-volt power supply and not use the 12-volt plug. That has solved the overheat problem. I think I am going to upgrade to the compressor type 12 volt refrigerator. draws much less power and you can set the temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Terry B

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice gents!
customer_reviews.text: This was for backseat of my ram 1500 pick up truck. For traveling from job site to job site. Always have cold water or a cold sandwich
customer_reviews.author: John Evans

customer_reviews.title: Crapped out after 1 month And 3 days
customer_reviews.text: Had this cooler for 1 month and 3 days, husband told me it crapped out today, it's no longer returnable and now my husband has nothing to keep his food cold in his truck... I thought coleman would be a better quality, I was wrong..
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice cooler, but you have to be careful not ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice cooler, but you have to be careful not to leave it plugged in when it's cold outside, or everything inside freezes.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: RETURNING AFTER JUST THREE DAYS! DEFECTIVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Returning this product after just three days of use. My husband is a truck driver and depends on a cooler for sandwiches and drinks. This is the poorest quality of Coleman cooler he has ever used. It has already blown four fuses. The plug gets far hotter than one would expect. It also does not get down to expected/stated temperature. WILL NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: CatIE H

customer_reviews.title: This works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after trying and returning a blue unit on wheels that could not even cool the internal space by 15 degrees. The Coleman unit easily maintained a very cold interior as advertised. I used it during four 6 hour drives and everything was cold inside. Be careful with fruits and vegetables. I kept them at the opposite end from the interior fan. It is light for its size and easy to carry. The exterior fan is large enough to make some noise and may bother some people in a quiet room.
customer_reviews.author: redkch

customer_reviews.title: Keeps drinks cold on the go! No ice required
customer_reviews.text: I could have gone with a regular ice chest, but having to stop and buy ice can be a pill. I use the ice pack to start the filling process, recommend starting off with cold products, really helps keep the cooler cooling. Now I use it to keep drinks cold in my car. After work grab a bottle of cold water. I have a horse, By the time I get to the horse stable cooler has cooled another beverage. Only downside. I have to keep rotating the ice pack from the cooler to the freezer. Guess that is the price one pays for cold drinks on the go
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Fan stays on all the time and 12v plug gets too hot!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fan is on all the time - can live with this, but the 12v plug gets so hot it can burn your hand or burn the item you place it in or on. I do not plug it in the 12v lighter because of this. It is dangerous. I bought it so I can plug it in the automobile!!!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money but keep it clean.
customer_reviews.text: My man is a truck driver and we meal prep every week. He is on the road for a week at a time. He loves his fridge. Keeps his food nice and cold. It plugs into his lighter port in his truck. Very convenient. Update: well it stopped working and my man took it apart thinking that it was a fuse. He ended up cleaning all the dust and dirt out of it and voila it works again. Definitely keep it clean. Thanks to the guy who suggested that you keep it clean in one of the reviews I was reading while my man was fooling with his.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for O-T-R truckers!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome for carrying food and drink while my husband is not home. Keeps everything extremely cold and will even freeze some of his drinks at times. He plugs it in and puts his prepackaged homemade meals and bottles of drinks in it and hits the road. Has enough room to carry enough for his 5 night runs. Cleans out quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: M Keeney

customer_reviews.title: It sits in my passenger seat
customer_reviews.text: I like this it is cheap compared to the value... but after a year or so u need to get a new dc plug for it as it gets hot, u can finde that at a truck stop! .... sometimes it will make loud squeaking noises and that's ok there is ice in it, just pull up the plastic piece inside that looks like a grill and get the ice out of it, or leave it unplugged for an hour or so.... other than that I still use it and it will freeze if u leave it in front of the ac in the truck
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: It is a good value for  a cooler not needing any ice. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: My only concern was that it froze up? Motor became stressed ,so I unplugged it. This happened 3 times, and it was fine after a rest. I loved how it plugged into my jeep, and that it had no freezer. I keep it as a cooler on all this summer thru alot of heat, so I just think it needed a break once in s while. I keep essential oil blends within it in my carport and then take it to farm markets. I am happy with how much it holds and at a good temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S.

customer_reviews.title: No Temperature Control
customer_reviews.text: The internal temperature can't be controlled. The unit allegedly will reduce the inside temperature to 40 degrees less the external air temperature. If the outside air temperature is too warm the contents will spoil. If the outside air temperature is too cool the contents will freeze.
customer_reviews.author: ureaka

customer_reviews.title: This is a COOLER not a refrigerator or freezer.
customer_reviews.text: I made a cross country trip for 3 weeks and used this to store drinks and insulin as I am a diabetic. I froze 4 Icey gel packs and put them inside. With the cooler plugged in to my cars system it would keep drinks cool for better than 2 days. It will only take temperature down 30 degrees below ambient. I would recommend this only to be used with the gel paks. When the car was parked overnight the gel paks helped to keep things cool. At night I placed the gel paks in freezer at Motel.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Worked once
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this cooler. It worked great the one and only time I was able to use it. However, we just went to use it again and it isn't working. We have only owned it for 4 months. I bought it because I trusted the Coleman brand. Very let down.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one of our coolers and I really love it. The cooler keeps thing cold but not to cold. Has plenty of room. It is a little noisy but I am not complaining. It is nice to be able to take items out of the cooler and not be dripping wet. I don't have to worry about purchasing ice. I have recommend it to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: SHARON T

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Work Long
customer_reviews.text: Husband is a truck driver. Bought for him (for Christmas) to keep his food items in without dealing with a regular cooler and melting ice. Worked great until yesterday. It is inoperative and a waste of money. I expected more out of a Coleman product and I definitely expected it to last longer than 2 months. And truthfully it hasn’t worked that long because he has only used it maybe 6 times since Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lawter

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work from day 1
customer_reviews.text: Received this cooler and it never worked turns on just fine but does not get cool inside. Bought this for my semi and it didn't work for cooling bought a different one at loves that works great. Would not recommend and it is to big for most cars to use to travel with unless you have room on the back seat.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed. I will return
customer_reviews.text: I Drive truck and take my meals with me, I bought this for that purpose. I used it 2 weeks and the 3rd week I was out 1 day on runs and the cooler Quit, I lost $60.00 worth of food, Very Disappointed. I will return. Absolute Junk. I have no intentions on buying anything Coleman again.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: They recommended unplugging for a few minutes because the motor/fan gets ...
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient at keeping items cold. Only concern is the motor made noise when using DC. We emailed Coleman and they responded within 24 hours. They recommended unplugging for a few minutes because the motor/fan gets too cold. We unplugged it for a few minutes and plugged back in, problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: carol harris

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easily cleaned
customer_reviews.text: We have used this cooler for nearly a year and found it to be such a great extension for cooling drinks and food while camping. Easily cleaned, durable. So handy
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible piece of junk. We have had to order 3 of these and everyone of them stops working after the first time. Contacting coleman now to make them resolve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Did not last very long, less then a year ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not last very long, less then a year. this is the 2nd electric cooler by Coleman and neither lasted. These coolers may get used once every 2 or 3 weeks for less then 4 to 6 hours each time, Spend your money on a top end cooler and your further ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I love this cooler...no more buying bags of ice!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works great and can get cold enough to freeze items if you have them sitting on the bottom of the cooler while the cooler is in a cool room....I used this on a road trip and it worked perfectly as I wanted some of the items to freeze while in my hotel room and stay partially frozen while driving to my next destination and plugged into my car. I also purchased the coleman thermoelectric cooler 120-volt adapter to be able to plug it into the wall outlet in my hotels. This is way better than buying ice and having it melt.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Good, but has its issues....
customer_reviews.text: I have purchases 6 of these over the last 4 years for my family.. they are such a great idea for traveling. I once transported frozen salmon for two days before I got home and it was still frozen. However, the Coleman cooler has its issues. 1. No easy cubby hole to tuck away the power cord and transfer former to 110v. .... 2. 3 so far power adapter have burned out that I have given to family. I went on Amazon and upgraded to a 8 amp. So far so good. If I was Coleman or a competitor, I would take note of this.
customer_reviews.author: Brian & Kitlan

customer_reviews.title: NOT A REFRIGERATOR
customer_reviews.text: Even though the product is advertised as an electric cooler, it IS NOT a refrigerator. Which, to me, seems a bit odd. Why NOT make it a refrigerator? Although, I can say that it did well keeping the temperature at a cold level for a few days, but then started to freeze items on the side with the fan, after about 3 days. Had to be careful where I kept items like vegetables. Meats stayed cool enough, although not super cold.
customer_reviews.author: DCW

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a long trip. It worked great, it is a decent size and can be used upright or laying down. The cons, the fan is loud, so when it is on the seat behind you for 800 miles it begins to get annoying. This unit does not come with a wall plug converter which means when you shut your car off it stops cooling and you have no way to plug it in your hotel I recommend getting a converter so it can be taken in when stop and turn up the radio to drown out the fan!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Denton

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I haven't taken on a trip yet but when I received it I plugged it in and let it run overnight. I live in Florida and the temp was adout 88 in my garage. I checked and the temp in the cooler was 40 I was shocked that was pretty good . I'm a retired Truck Driver that had one of these cooler 20 years ago and nothing like this . The one thing I wish it had was a on off switch .. Planning a trip in couple weeks so will see how it works
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS E MYERS

customer_reviews.title: Only worked about 2 and a half months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in August and its already stopped working. I believe the issue is with the power cord. No power, replaced the fuses, which had blown, still no power, not the cigarette lighter, it still works. The return window is closed, so Im just out my money??
customer_reviews.author: Trissa Black

customer_reviews.title: Read ALL instructions & recommendations before buying!
customer_reviews.text: Had to return first one b/c it straight up did NOT work! This one works, but is still smelly! Even read & followed all suggestions (i.e., don’t block vents or whatever... spouse did the research), but still smelly after a couple-three uses.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Shrink

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to our camper
customer_reviews.text: We camp in an Aframe pop up and needed a cooler for produce, drinks and non-perishable food. This works wonderfully. Used it this week for the first time and had no problems. The great thing about it is it can be setup as a fridge(upright) or as a cooler. The only concern I have is the 12 volt plug gets very hot. Past reviews state this also. Will update this review if it becomes a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lastayt

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: We used it as we drove to and from Oregon to Texas. It kept all the sandwich stuff perfectly cold like fridge at home. It didn’t run without the engine on but we transferred cold kept items in the fridge in hotel rooms. When we got back I found a connector to be able to plug it in to house. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big ice-less thermoelectric cooler
customer_reviews.text: Great thermoelectric cooler. I bought this to take hunting and camping. It's great for the trip over. And, It kept my food and drinks cold with no ice while only being plugged in about an hour a day, and ~25 degree nights. I fit more than 5 days worth of food and drink for two people in here. It's amazing how much room there is when you don't put any ice!
customer_reviews.author: E. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 60 days and died
customer_reviews.text: I had one for 2 years and never had a problem until it died. The new one only lasted 60 days and it quit working on me out of nowhere. Do not buy this product as it only has a 30 day warranty and that is about how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Christene

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler!!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with these coolers, I just bought my second one because I finally wore out the first one after around 3 years of almost every day use, and at times in the spring and fall riding in my truck when it wasn’t so hot outside it would have ice in my milk and tea, so love these coolers.
customer_reviews.author: Bman

customer_reviews.title: Good Coleman Product
customer_reviews.text: Good item for travel. We cool it down before the trip with ice packs takes about 4 hours to get to 40 degrees. Bought the adapter. Can't keep it on while driving as the fan is too noisy for us but we plug it in at rest stops. Not a refrigerator but better then bags of ice. Plenty big too
customer_reviews.author: M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: For a truckers like me I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Keep your food and fruits fresh, not that cold but enough to chill. For a truckers like me I recommend it, it saves a lot of time and money, no more buying ice and dumping water everyday. Nice OTR cooler
customer_reviews.author: jeog magaño

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing to say the least.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on day TWO of using this cooler and it suddenly stopped working. I've followed the user instructions and unplugged it when we've been stopped on our roadtrip as to not kill our truck battery. After investigating and attempting to figure out why my supposed to be great buy quit working I discovered the spring thingy for the 12V is, yup, missing. Day TWO. Day. TWO. This is inconvenient and disappointing to say the least. I have 7 more days on this road trip and limited space. I just hope I can get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hughes

customer_reviews.title: it is not a refrigerator
customer_reviews.text: have only had this product for a short time however I have the same unit in my OTR truck for the last 1/2dozen years with no issues other than if you forget and leave it on for some time your vehicle battery will be dead
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little camping fridge!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these almost a year ago to use with my teardrop camper. One of my best camping purchases ever! As long as you keep it in the shade, it keeps up very well, even on really hot days. We had it outside the camper one night when the temps got down to the 50s, and woke up to find everything inside it FROZEN! I use it primarily for food, so I can keep the opening and closing of the door to a minimum, and freeze what food I can before storing inside.
customer_reviews.author: Teachlaw

customer_reviews.title: Draws insane amounts of power
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my drinks and food colder than I expected, but not as cold as a true fridge. Draws WAY too much power! I have 360 watts of panels and 2 200ah AGM batteries and even in sunny weather cant run the cooler 24/7. Had a year and on ditching to splurge on a dometic. I'd only recommend this if you're always on shore power and dont care about your electric bill!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Moorby

customer_reviews.title: Worked only once!
customer_reviews.text: I had an Igloo electric cooler that worked great for over 20 years! I threw it out because it had gotten icky from so much use thinking i would just buy a new one. Unfortunately, I found out afterward that Igloo doesn't make them anymore so I purchased this Coleman thinking Coleman has always made reliable products but I guess that was in the past because this one only worked once. The second time I went to use it, it actually got warm inside instead of cool. I would not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Gil

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: Should have listened to the other reviewers. Had one previously that lasted over 10 years. Loved it. So I ignored current reviews and bought another. Didn't even last three months. Still under warranty but you have to pay to ship it back. Costs way to much to ship!!!! I'm going back to ice!
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd R Worthen

customer_reviews.title: Runs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality. Fantastic price. I didn’t need to splice any cords. Just remember it’s not a refrigerator. You can’t run it for more than 2 or 3 days straight. I plug it in when I get up in the morning, and unplug it before I go to bed at night. Keeps everything cool. Keep the thermal motor clear for best air circulation and put small kitchen at base to absorb any condensation.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler! Don’t forget to buy the electric cord to plug indoors.
customer_reviews.text: I love using this on my trips. Fits in the back seat of my truck. The only thing I do not like is I had to buy a separate cord to plug inside while not in vehicle (not sellers fault). It says you can’t leave it in vehicle for more than 4 hours or it will drain battery but takes 3 hours to cool before using.... it should come with both cords in my opinion. But thank goodness amazon has the other cord!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler for road trips
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to take a cross country, ten day road trip. It gets plenty cold during a days drive to keep your food cool through the night unplugged if you don’t leave the lid open too long and it’s not too hot outside. The size was great and not too loud. We only wished it would have been clear whether or not it came with a wall plug as well or just the plug for your car; as it only came with the 12v plug but we didn’t know that in time. So just to be perfectly clear, you have to order the 110v wall plug adapter separately! Bummer we didn’t know that beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt Last Very Long
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased one of these coolers for my husband that drives a semi cross country and needed a cooler for his truck. After only a few months it went out. I was able to return it because it was under warranty and received another one in the first week of November. Not a month later the same issue happened, it stopped working. Maybe these coolers are not equipped to run continuous, just maybe good enough for 1 annual camping trip with the family but that's it. I have decided to go to Igloo and give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy Something Else!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to give it 1 star for this to post....but I wouldn't be that generous. I bought this cooler because of 2 things; 1.) I felt I needed one for my RV travels, 2.) It's Coleman!!! What I formerly thought was a 'Quality' product. I've tried it in 2 positions.....TERRIBLE! It really doesn't cool and I put 'ONLY' cold product in it. It stays constantly in an air-conditioned environment by the way. NOW!!!! NOW!!!! IT SOUNDS LIKE A WEED-EATER!!!! You know, the kind of contraption used for trimming in the lawn!!! GADS!!! Such a disappointment. I've time to return it and I will....I'll just do without. Also makes me re-think any future Coleman purchases. John
customer_reviews.author: John L. Gaudet

customer_reviews.title: Best cooler ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for going out of town and for parties when I over fill the fridge or for drinks outside for everyone. I take it to condos when I go on vacation so that I can bring all my food and drinks with me. My mom has one also and loves it. Super huge and can hold a ton of stuff and super quiet and you can plug it in the house or the car!!
customer_reviews.author: Miles Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cooler
customer_reviews.text: We had one that was approximately 10 years old that really needed to be replaced. We love this cooler and use when we are camping since our pop up fridge was so small. It's also great for parties because I don't need to remember ice. Takes a while to cool down so I always pug it in the night before.
customer_reviews.author: A. Matt

customer_reviews.title: Cooler is junk! Won't last!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought one of these years ago as an otr truck driver. 120 something bucks at a truck stop. Broke within a month. Years later in a local trucking job now and saw it much cheaper on Amazon and thought maybe I'll have have better luck this time. Dead within 2 weeks. Got free replacement, and made it past a month and thought 3rd times the charm. Nope, died again. I've had 3 of these in all and none lasted longer than 2 months. This cooler is junk and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Lots of use.
customer_reviews.text: We take alot of road trips now that we're retired. Driving a chevy Tahoe throughout the US is crazy. This cooler plugs right into the rear outlet and fits perfectly between the 2nd row captain's chairs! We use the 110 outlet, but it has a cigar lighter adapter too. It holds alot of drinks and sandwiches, so you dont have to stop to often. We now use it to go camping, and plug it into our portable solar panel.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Does not get cool at all. We have used it twice and it has either frozen over or just doesn’t get cool. Ended up unplugging and using freezer things in it like a regular ice chest. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: slaghfamily

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is so awesome, I use it yr round in my van and its just a bit more work in the winter because I have to turn it off most of the time so it doesnt freeze stuff, if its at least 75 it works best.
customer_reviews.author: joni

customer_reviews.title: Keeps things cold
customer_reviews.text: I’m a truck driver and a good cooler is essential, this one fills my need and performs flawlessly. The price on Amazon was $20-$25 dollars cheaper than I would have paid at a truck stop. And as always shipping was prompt. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: We have had refrigerator coolers for years and our last one died recently. They can be so expensive, but this one is a great price and is the same quality as before! It works well and is easy to travel with!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Ok product not built to last like they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many of these over my 20 year driving career. They work as intended nothing special. They usually last me 2 to 2-1/2years maybe the old ones lasted 5 years then Id but a new one. The originals ones were better you could just replace the fan and the cord then Coleman decided to stop that because thet weren’t selling enough.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Keller

customer_reviews.title: Great unit. Perfect for road trips
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd. The first one still works, but we misplaced the cord and we weren’t sure it would work. But once we hooked up the new cord to the old one it was working fine. So now we just have to buy a new charger cord for it. We love it for road trips. We can stop for picnics along our trips. Much cheaper than eating out every meal. These are the best value and the stay very cold.
customer_reviews.author: Fergie

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise- it's great for a job site instead of hauling ice everyday
customer_reviews.text: Does the job- once it's cold, it'll stay cold- advice: don't leave it on/plugged in during the winter. It will always lower the temp 30-40 degrees lower than whats outside- I did this once and it froze over and all the cans exploded. Otherwise- it's great for a job site instead of hauling ice everyday.
customer_reviews.author: W. Savoy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cooler
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cooler. It is so nice for my husband not to have to go to the gas station and buy ice every morning. Working construction he has a year round need for a cooler of cold drinks! When he is in his big truck we plug this in and in other trucks use the 120 volt adapter. Both work well.
customer_reviews.author: Sports Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling with food
customer_reviews.text: With the virus raging I decided to bring most of my food on our trip from Texas to Colorado. We spent two nights on the road in hotels. I put the food in frozen with a large ice pack and bought the converter to plug it in when we were in the hotels. The food was solidly frozen after 3 days and 2 nights on the road. We loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Miller

customer_reviews.title: cooling works.
customer_reviews.text: The plug supplied gets too hot to hold. But the cooling works.
customer_reviews.author: barnstormer

customer_reviews.title: No power cord for the house
customer_reviews.text: No power cord for the house so it will be tough to figure out how good it works. Update: Don't use this for a fridge even if you think it's maybe the end of the world. It lasted around 3 weeks and that's with me putting ice in it and shutting it off for a while everyday. This was my mistake. I must have missed it in the ad.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain
customer_reviews.text: I figured there'd be some reason why this was "like new but used". One minor glitch that the cord was stuck. Took 3 min's with a screw driver to loosen and then free the power cord up. Fabulous bargain for that tiny bit of inconvenience. Less than half it's new cost!
customer_reviews.author: David Beal

customer_reviews.title: A travel must
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cooler out there. Plug it in , for travel in the car take it to hotel room and using 12 volt adapter, now fridge in the room. If you have kids this is a must. Kids can get snacks, fruit, drinks, and not bother us while driving. Plus leftovers can go right into the cooler/ portable fridge, depending on your perspective. No need to get ice or freezer packs.
customer_reviews.author: JustRandom

customer_reviews.title: Great little chill box.
customer_reviews.text: Saves on ice money, pays for itself in less than a year. Has to be defrosted every week as it runs constantly. Gets noisy after frost builds up and the fan blades start hitting the frost. It's a good Chill box and keeps food from spoiling, which is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: jjqxsevv

customer_reviews.title: Coleman cooler is the best working
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and works well. I used this for a week. It’s possible that this can freeze the items on the bottom. Gets cold and stays cold if you need to unplug it for an hour or so. I recommend removing any water from the bottom because it will freeze. Overall I am very happy with that Coleman cooler. I’ve never been disappointed with Coleman camping products.
customer_reviews.author: Susi Paulina

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: LOVED THIS for a year and a half. Plugged into my car for long drives and got the adapter to plug it into the house for loading and unloading. Then it died.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Wires will short out and blow fuse in short amount of time
customer_reviews.text: This cooler works really well, 40 below ambient temperature as claimed. After 36 days blew fuse. Had a dead short across neg and pos. 6 days past point of no return so I took off the outside fan cover and discovered the tiny wires go between the evaporator sharp edge and cooler were rubbing and pulled tight with a wire tie. I cut the wire tie and insulated with electrical tape by pushing it behind then wrapping all wires. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey j. todd

customer_reviews.title: Power cord didt last 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I drive a big truck for a living, needed. A cooler for my truck, WAS, tired of buying ice, purchase the Coleman power chill. It work very well, but my power cord has STOP WORKING, A HAVE NOT HAD THE COOLER 2 MONTH'S .$90.00 is alot for not 2 MONTHS of service, ?????
customer_reviews.author: Dittybop

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I drive truck and don’t have room even for a small refrigerator so I bought this cooler but was very disappointed it wouldn’t even keep milk cold.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L

customer_reviews.title: usually last a year
customer_reviews.text: usually last a year in the big truck.outside temperature effect it.. lowers about 40 degrees , best one on the road to use.. fans can be replaced ..
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: cooler
customer_reviews.text: Not real happy with it. It does the job as long as you are traveling. Stop for the night it has to go in with you and be plugged in . Leave in vehicle plugged in and it will drain the battery. Used it one trip AZ to WA. and sits in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Holmes

customer_reviews.title: It is a glorified ice chest
customer_reviews.text: It works ok. It keeps stuff cool, not cold. It will not make atuff cold either. It needs to be put in there as cold as possible and the cooler will keep it coldish
customer_reviews.author: Christopher farrar

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but don’t last very long.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, it works just as it’s advertised and if you know how to organize things, you can fit a lot of things in this cooler. My only issue with it is that it last less than a year. You can easily replace the fan and keep using it but sometimes is not just the fan. I’m a truck driver and I use this cooler a lot so that’s why I keep going back to get another one when it breaks, It allows me to save more than I spend so it’s worth it for the most part... I’ve had bought bad units before but they either replace it or give you back the money.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy
customer_reviews.text: We are extremely pleased! We noted the po precaution NOT to cover or hinder the fan unit plus do not let it run longer than 4 hours. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mahar

customer_reviews.title: Dud, Check immediately if it works
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cooler for my Memorial Day trip to store drinks. It does not work at all. The fan does not blow the light on the cord does not come on. The plug-in in my vehicle worked because I tested other devices it in. The cooler said it had defects but nothing about it not working. My boyfriend uses this same model of cooler in his truck to keep food while over the road. This cooler was a dud. I would like a refund or a working cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Leimbach

customer_reviews.title: A very nice cooler to travel with!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned several electric coolers and use them all the time. I drive truck and pack my lunch at home and it’s will keep whatever you need cold throughout the day without the use of ice. Do not leave plugged in overnight as it will kill the battery in most vehicle overnight, also unplug in cold weather as it will freeze cans of soda.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Mackner

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with quality of product
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the cooler May 1st and then left on a one month driving vacation about a month & a half later. The cooler worked fine for the first couple of weeks and then suddenly wouldn't go on. Not sure what the problem is. Have submitted a question to the company, but 4 days later I have not received a response. It's totally useless at this point because you an not supposed to use ice in this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product is just as stated
customer_reviews.text: Hubby uses in his semi. This brand is the only one we have tried and these seem to last a couple years being used daily 24/7 before the motor burns out.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work when I know it will be hot out. It keeps our water cool, but beware it will drain your battery fast if you leave it plugged in for 8-10 hours without running your vehicle. It fits nicely in the back seat of my truck and very convenient compared to traditional ice coolers.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Missing the 120 Volt AC plug!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, very thin plastic, and missing the 120 Volt AC (Wall Outlet)! Boo! I had to purchase this separately. It would be nice if it included an extra shelf. It takes a bit to cool which is a bummer. I will update you with the road trip (fridge) experience soon.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Casas

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase this year for camping
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Coleman thermoelectric cooler twice, for a 7-day and 4-day camping trip. The cooler definitely stays colder at least 40 degrees less than the outdoor temp. The latter trip nights were in the fifties and my juice was almost completely frozen by morning. Fall camping I won’t have to plug it in over night. Compared to the Yeti I have, which this Coleman cooler has now replaced, it holds much more, Is easier to carry and still lighter than the yeti. I love this cooler. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Petit

customer_reviews.title: We use 2 Coleman Powerchill 40 qt Thermo Electric coolers
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Quiet. Arrived perfect. We use 2 until a new refrigerator can be installed in RV. This was $98 without power supply for 120 VAC to 12 VDC. Other Coleman Powerchill 40 qt Thermo Electric cooler was $94 with power supply. It seems that "with power cord" means sold with power supply. We defrost on third day, we disconnect power 1.5 hours with towel below cooling fins to collect melted ice. With power on again, cooler is good for 3 more days.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lee Elliott

customer_reviews.title: A travel cigarette lighter 12v Refrigerator
customer_reviews.text: Works great! plug it in and the thing gets cold like a refrigerator! Unplug it and let it float. How never is a great off grid component, works with 12v cigarette lighter plug in...perfect for RV'S or if you're living in car or van. Or traveling in a car or suv. The cooler stay plugged in while driving in the trunk or hatchback...ice cold box....takes about an hour to build up to ice cold...
customer_reviews.author: ali barnwell

customer_reviews.title: Highly recomended
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for good friend. Very happy with unit Been in operation for several years without interuption
customer_reviews.author: Denis Dore

customer_reviews.title: The cooler works great for travel in the car and stopping over night to plug into AC.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Coleman cooler. Mine fell on the floor and I could not get it to work on the AC. I ordered this one. When it came I tried my cord and could not get it to run on AC. I tried it in the car and it ran. I realized it was the cord that had also fallen to the floor that was not working. I tried my old cooler in the car and it worked. I'm sorry to have returned the cooler but I did order another AC cord. This is my 3rd cooler in over 40 years and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: hildred neilso

customer_reviews.title: this may have been a lemon, but....
customer_reviews.text: received product promptly. have had one previously and used extensively with no problem for quite a while. this one, however, has had the whole tip of the cigarette-lighter male plug that inserts into the cars cigarette lighter, completely fall apart three times in about 3 months. Husband been able to re-assemble it each time, but its poor design and won't stay fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

product_meta.title: Coleman Cooler| 40-Quart Portable Cooler | Iceless Electric Cooler with cooling technology up to 40°F for Picnics, BBQs, camping, tailgates and Outdoors
product_meta.description: The Coleman PowerChill Portable Thermoelectric Cooler keeps food items at the perfect temperature when you're on the road. This portable thermoelectric cooler keeps its contents up to 40 degrees cooler than the surrounding temperature without the need for ice, making it ideal for keeping beverages and perishables cold. Perfect for long road trips, this portable cooler and food warmer features a compact design that fits easily into the cabin or trunk of most cars. A storage tray helps you keep your food and beverages organized, while a convertible door opens from either the right or left side to offer added placement flexibility. And thanks to the included 12-volt plug and 8-foot power cord, you can easily power this portable cooler using a car or boat outlet.
feature_bullets: Cold thermoelectric cooler keeps food items at an optimal temperature
Keeps contents up to 40 degrees colder than the surrounding temperature
8-foot power cord allows you to the power the cooler with a car or boat outlet
Door opens from either the left or right side to offer added placement flexibility
40-quart capacity holds up to 44 cans. Lightweight travel design

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
